name: Low flow depth
functionStatement: Ensures habitat availability and water quality during low water levels, and indicates non-storm conditions experienced the majority of the time.
descriptionMarkdown: Evaluates whether the reach maintains adequate wetted depth and continuity during low flow by integrating pool depth, wetted length, exposed bed, and Q90/Q10 differences.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Use available indicators (pool depth, wetted length, exposed bed, Q90/Q10 vs reference) and rate condition based on combined evidence.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Disconnected, very shallow pools; bed mostly exposed.
Criteria: Wetted length 75%, or Q90/Q10 differ >50%.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Mostly isolated pools with narrow trickles; shallow depths.
Criteria: Wetted length about 25-50% or exposed bed 50-75%, or Q90/Q10 differ ~30-50%.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Several dry riffles but pools connected; moderate depth.
Criteria: Wetted length about 50-75% or exposed bed 25-50%, or Q90/Q10 within ~20-30% of reference.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Continuous wetted thread with short dry patches; pools hold water.
Criteria: Wetted length >75% or exposed bed <25%, or Q90/Q10 within ~20% of reference.
